DOC.brief_title: Whole-Neck Computed Tomography Perfusion Scan Imaging Patients With Head Neck Tumors
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To assess difference whole-neck compute tomography perfusion ( WNCTP ) parameter ( blood volume [ BV ] , blood flow [ BF ] , capillary permeability [ CP ] mean transit time [ MTT ] ) head neck tumor mass ( benign malignant ) adjacent normal skeletal muscle within patient . II . To assess whether difference WNCTP parameter tumor mass adjacent normal skeletal muscle different patient benign tumor versus ( vs. ) malignant tumor . III . To assess correlation WNCTP parameter tumor mass adjacent normal skeletal muscle . IV . Determine suspicious cervical lymph node see use whole-neck coverage employ WNCTP compare limited coverage traditional neck CTP . OUTLINE : Patients undergo WNCTP scan 2-3 minute standard care compute tomography ( CT ) . After completion study , patient follow within 2 day .
